name: Find common factors of a set of numbers including the HCF

skills.name: Identify common factors of two numbers
Identify the Highest Common Factor of two numbers
Identify the Highest Common Factor of three or more numbers

explanations.A: I think you have forgotten to consider all of the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 5 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists.
explanations.B: The factors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. The factors of 20 are 1, 2, 4, 5, 10, 20. So only 4 is a factor of both 12 and 20. Tom is incorrect. Katie is correct.
explanations.C: I think you have forgotten to consider all of the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 5 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists.
explanations.D: I think you have forgotten to consider all of the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 5 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists.

explanations.A: The factors of 15 are 1, 3, 5, 15. The factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. So only 3 is a factor of both 15 and 24. Tom is correct. Katie is incorrect.
explanations.B: I think you have miscalculated the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 10 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists to see if 15 and 24 are multiples of both.
explanations.C: I think you have miscalculated the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 10 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists to see if 15 and 24 are multiples of both.
explanations.D: I think you have forgotten to consider all of the multiples of 3 and 4. Consider listing the first 10 multiples of 3 and 4 before comparing the two lists to see if 15 and 24 are multiples of both.

explanations.A: I think you have chosen a factor of both 12 and 24, but it is not the HCF. Consider writing a full list of factors of the two numbers before comparing them.
explanations.B: The factors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. The factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. So the HCF of 12 and 24 is 12.
explanations.C: I think you have just chosen the largest number. 24 is not a factor of 12. Consider writing a full list of factors of the two numbers before comparing them.
explanations.D: I think you may have confused factors and multiples. Remember factors are numbers that go into a given number an exact number of times. e.g. 2 is a factor of 10

explanations.A: I think you have chosen a factor of both 16 and 48, but it is not the HCF. Consider writing a full list of factors of the two numbers before comparing them.
explanations.B: I think you have added the two numbers together. The highest common factor is the largest number that they are both divisible by. Consider writing a full list of factors of the two numbers before comparing them.
explanations.C: The factors of 16 are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. The factors of 48 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 16, 24, 48. So the HCF of 16 and 48 is 16.
explanations.D: I think you may have confused factors and multiples. Remember factors are numbers that go into a given number an exact number of times. e.g. 2 is a factor of 10

explanations.A: I think you have chosen a common factor, however 4 is not the HIGHEST common factor. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.B: I think you have chosen a factor of 24 but not 16. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.C: The factors of 16 are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16. The factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. Therefore, the highest common factor would be 8.
explanations.D: I think you have found a factor of 24, but not 16. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.

explanations.A: I think you have chosen a common factor, however 3 is not the HIGHEST common factor. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.B: I think you have chosen a factor of 18 but not 24. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.C: The factors of 18 are 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 18. The factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. Therefore, the highest common factor would be 6.
explanations.D: I think you have found a factor of 24, but not 18. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.

explanations.A: I think you have assumed that because 7 is a prime number, they would have no common factors. Consider the factors of 7, what factor does 7 have in common with 24?
explanations.B: The factors of 7 are 1 and 7. The factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24. Therefore the highest common factor would be 1.
explanations.C: I think you have just stated the smallest number. 7 is not a factor of 24, therefore it could not be the highest common factor of 7 and 24. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.D: They definitely have a factor in common. 7 is a prime number, meaning that it only has two factors. What are these factors? Are either of them also factors of 24?

explanations.A: I think you have assumed that because 11 is a prime number, they would have no common factors. Consider the factors of 11, what factor does 11 have in common with 12?
explanations.B: The factors of 11 are 1 and 11. The factors of 12 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12. Therefore the highest common factor would be 1.
explanations.C: I think you have just stated the smallest number. 11 is not a factor of 12, therefore it could not be the highest common factor of 11 and 12. Consider listing the factors of both numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.D: They definitely have a factor in common. 11 is a prime number, meaning that it is only has two factors. What are these factors? Are either of them also factors of 12?

explanations.A: I think you may have missed out some factors. Consider listing the factors for all three numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.B: I think that you have assumed that they are all in the 3 times table. Neither 26 nor 65 are divisible by 3. Consider listing the factors of all 3 numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.C: 26, 39 and 65 are all in the 13 timestable. You know this is the highest common factor of the three numbers because the factors of 26 are 1, 2, 13 and 26. 39 and 65 do not divide by 26 but they do divide by 13, so 13 must be the HCF.
explanations.D: I think you have just chosen the smallest number, which is not a factor of the larger two numbers. Consider listing the factors of all 3 numbers in order to identify the HCF.

explanations.A: I think you may have missed out some factors. Consider listing the factors for all three numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.B: 6 is a common factor but it is not the HIGHEST common factor. Consider listing the factors of all 3 numbers in order to identify the HCF.
explanations.C: 24, 36 and 72 are all in the 12 times table. You know this is the highest common factor of the three numbers because the factors of 24 are 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 12 and 24. 36 and 72 do not divide by 24 but they do divide by 12, so 12 must be the HCF.
explanations.D: I think you have just chosen the smallest number, which is not a factor of both of the larger two numbers. Consider listing the factors of all 3 numbers in order to identify the HCF.
